jtxt.emulator.tui

Class SequentialLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • jtxt.emulator.tui.SequentialLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Layout

    public class SequentialLayout
extends java.lang.Object
implements Layout
    A Layout which aligns components along an axis, and which wraps Components which overflow the bounds of their parent container onto the next suitable Location within the container, such that no two components will ever intersect.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SequentialLayout.SequentialParameters
      The parameter object which describes the width and height of a component that is added to this Layout's container.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Axis axis
      The axis that components will be aligned on.
      private int extent
      The width or height (depending on the Axis that this layout is initialized with) of the largest Component on this layout's major axis.
      private Location next
      The upper-right corner of the bounding box that is to be returned to the next component that requests bounds within the container.
      private Region parentBounds
      The bounds of the parent container that components requesting bounding information are being added to.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SequentialLayout(Axis axis) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Region getBounds(java.lang.Object params)
      Calculates the size of the Region that a Component may be placed within, using the given parameters object to make this calculation.

      Sets the bounds of the parent container that this Layout manages.

        setComponentBounds

    • Field Detail

      • axis

        private final Axis axis
        The axis that components will be aligned on. If this value is set to Axis.X, components will be layed out horizontally before being wrapped to the next available line; otherwise, they will be aligned vertically before being wrapped.

      • parentBounds

        private Region parentBounds
        The bounds of the parent container that components requesting bounding information are being added to.

      • next

        private Location next
        The upper-right corner of the bounding box that is to be returned to the next component that requests bounds within the container. The lower- left corner will be generated when the width and height are known, and rely on the axis that we are laying components out against.

      • extent

        private int extent
        The width or height (depending on the Axis that this layout is initialized with) of the largest Component on this layout's major axis.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SequentialLayout

        public SequentialLayout(Axis axis)

    • Method Detail

      • setParentBounds

        public void setParentBounds(Region parentBounds)
        Description copied from interface: Layout
        Sets the bounds of the parent container that this Layout manages.
        Specified by:
        setParentBounds in interface Layout
        Parameters:
        parentBounds - The bounds of the Container that this Layout manages.

      • getBounds

        public Region getBounds(java.lang.Object params)
        Description copied from interface: Layout
        Calculates the size of the Region that a Component may be placed within, using the given parameters object to make this calculation. The type of this object, as well as the way that it affects the determination of the bounds, is implementation-dependent. This method may throw an error if the type of this parameter is incorrect (because a client passed an incorrect parameter when constructing a Component).
        Specified by:
        getBounds in interface Layout
        Parameters:
        params - An object which describes the positioning information that will be used to calculate these bounds. This is implementation dependent, and the type of this object is likely to change between different Layouts.
        Returns:
        The bounds that the parameters object represents.
